website_summaries.verdict: A nice camera with good resolution that can provide a quick picture of a home heat situation.
pros: Can capture a wide thermal range
Comes with a plastic shell to help it withstand rough treatment
cons: This unit does not record video
Must be plugged into your computer to download images

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed with software requirements!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. My only gripe is FLIRs software. They practically want a DNA sample for you to download and use it! In this day and age of identity theft, it's just uncalled for! And, unfortunately, some features of this device are not usable without that software. Which makes this only good for personal diagnoses use. Not great for customer presentation. Would rate 2 1/2 stars if I could. If anybody knows of 3rd party software that can be used with this please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: This thing was a real pain
customer_reviews.text: Got the first one it was defective called flir for a fix they did not even know what the c3 was so i returned it got another one came with the same defect and looked like someone had already been in the box and returned it if you are planning on using this for any kind of professional purpose spend the extra cash on the e4
customer_reviews.author: lucas

customer_reviews.title: Lack of instructions and the charger is poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer, I too had a problem getting the charger body to mate with the appropriate adapter. I think the adapter is supposed to snap into the housing but I was afraid to force the two pieces together and so I gave up and returned the item. I was not willing to put up with a poorly designed charging system for a camera system that cost me this much. Also, the instruction manual is severely lacking in information. Plenty of language versions but there's no content.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: infrared magic
customer_reviews.text: bought this thing originally to use to detect heat leaks around windows and doors. works perfect for that. we had a hurricane come through and our town went completely dark. I mean dark. reminded me of nights in Vietnam between parachute flares. my wife's black cat ran out of the house andn we though she was gone. my wife was frantic. I got the camera and panned around the shrubbery and lo and behold she was hiding under one on the side of the house. expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Burch

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE FLIR DOESN’T SUPPORT MAC... good luck using the software.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this purchase. I kicked the idea of investing in a Thermal camera for some time now but FLIR flopped when I finally pulled the trigger. It works well enough but the screen is garbage. There’s 3 blurry lines running vertically on the display and blotchy, white pixels, at the top and right. Worst of all, Flir discontinued all software on the Apple Store. This is a huge issue considering I don’t own a PC. How am I supposed to update the firmware to maximize it’s effectiveness if you’ve given me no way to update the software? Great idea... poorly executed.
customer_reviews.author: KEn

customer_reviews.title: Way overpriced for quality
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this thing at all. Resolution is very poor considering the price. Support is non-existent. This is my second Flir camera and I've had issues early on with both, mostly having to do with artifacts and shadows on the image which makes it unusable. Done with FLIR!
customer_reviews.author: Frogster

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know I was buying  lemons from Flir

customer_reviews.title: WHAT ARE YOU BARKING AT?
customer_reviews.text: Well my first test IMMEDIATELY proved the worth of this device as my dog was alerting me to something that was invisible (while still in plain site) to me. I pulled out my new FLIR camera and "WOW" there was a second heat signature. But more over, there was a 3rd heat signature that later revealed the racoon was a mother and she had her babies hidden in the base of the tree. I would still like to see LARGER images (downloaded), a protective and waterproof case (I purchased a Pelican which was perfect), a video mode and bluetooth mode. Additionally when you transition the before and after photos it takes the WOW factor to an entirely new level.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for my diagnostics toolbag.

I have been able to isolate the location of water penetration through a single ply roofing membrane which is usually very difficult to do. My only minor complaint is the low resolution of images. That, is a very small complaint considering the thousands of dollars that I have saved my clients with this tool so far, though.

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit and easy to use, great price, but resolution is a good value for the price which is low
customer_reviews.text: This is a very inexpensive IR camera that is well made. I have had a few issues where it lost sync between the two sensors (visible and infrared), but a reboot of the camera resolved it. Very easy to use, but note it is not a high resolution IR camera. I also bought the E8 for $3K and the more expensive camera has dramatically better resolution. This is a good camera to get started with, but I like the E8 for serious thermodynamic analysis. Not that the resolution is not good enough for small electronics.

product_meta.title: Flir C3 – Compact Thermal Camera with Wi-Fi
product_meta.description: Style:WiFi Enabled - C3: Thermal Camera OnlyThe FLIR C3 is a full-featured, pocket-sized thermal camera designed to be your go-to tool, whether your work is building inspections, facilities maintenance, HVAC, or electrical repair. Keep it on you so you’re ready anytime to find hot fuses, cold air leaks, plumbing issues, and more. The C3’s must-have features include MSX real time image enhancement, area maximum or minimum temperature measurement, high sensitivity and Wi-Fi connectivity.
feature_bullets: Portability Pocket Portable Thermal Camera with Msx Enhanced Thermal Images providing stunning detail to help you identify problem areas easier
FLIR One displays live thermal infrared imagery using the FLIR one iPhone app so you can see the world from a thermal perspective

Wireless connectivity Wi-Fi Connectivity transfers images wirelessly to mobile platforms. Standard is 802.11 b/g/n. Operating temperature range is minus 10 to 50 degree Celsius. Digital camera is 640 x 480 pixel
Measurement Modes – Center Spot or Area Min/Max allowing you to quickly measure within a defined area box

Image Modes: “MSX” adds key details from the on board digital light camera to the IR image adding detail and clarity; "Picture in picture" overlays a fixed Section of a thermal image onto a digital photo to clarify problem locations and enhance documentation. Spectral Range: 7.5 - 14.0 µm. Storage Temperature Range:–40°C to 70°C ( 40°F to 158°F)
Includes: Infrared camera, lanyard, pouch, power supply/charger, tripod mount, USB cable, printed documentation
Brilliant 3" intuitive touch screen with auto orientation for easy viewing
